about.description:
D-Bus is a message bus, used for sending messages between applications.
Conceptually, it fits somewhere in between raw sockets and CORBA in
terms of complexity.

This package provides a Python interface to D-Bus.

See the dbus description for more information about D-Bus in general.

name: dbus-python
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "dbus-python" %}
{% set version = "1.2.16" %}

package:
  name: "{{ name|lower }}"
  version: "{{ version }}"

source:
  url: "https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz"
  sha256: 11238f1d86c995d8aed2e22f04a1e3779f0d70e587caffeab4857f3c662ed5a4

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - make  # [unix]
    - pkg-config  # [unix]
  host:
    - dbus
    - glib
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - dbus
    - glib
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - dbus
  requires:
    - pkg-config  # [unix]
  commands:
    - pkg-config --print-errors --modversion dbus-python  # [unix]

about:
  home: "http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/DBusBindings/#python"
  dev_url: "https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus-python"
  doc_url: "https://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-python/"
  license: "MIT"
  license_family: "MIT"
  license_file: "COPYING"
  summary: "Python bindings for dbus"
  description: |
     D-Bus is a message bus, used for sending messages between applications.
     Conceptually, it fits somewhere in between raw sockets and CORBA in
     terms of complexity.

     This package provides a Python interface to D-Bus.

     See the dbus description for more information about D-Bus in general.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - duncanmmacleod
